titleStmt.title: By the Queene the Queenes most excellent Maiestie, finding the great misusage in the execution of sundry of her Highnesse grants made to diuer persons, touching certaine penall statutes ... touching the obtaining and recovery of lands and tenements concealed ...
titleStmt.author: England and Wales. Sovereign (1558-1603 : Elizabeth I)
Elizabeth I, Queen of England, 1533-1603.

titleStmt.title: By the Queene the Queenes most excellent Maiestie, finding the great misusage in the execution of sundry of her Highnesse grants made to diuer persons, touching certaine penall statutes ... touching the obtaining and recovery of lands and tenements concealed ...
titleStmt.author: England and Wales. Sovereign (1558-1603 : Elizabeth I)
Elizabeth I, Queen of England, 1533-1603.

publicationStmt.publisher: By Christopher Barker, Printer to the Queenes most excellent Maiestie,

notesStmt.note: Revoking commissions to inquire into concealments.
STC (2nd ed.) suggests actual date of publication is 1618.
"Giuen at our Mannor of Greenwich the xv. of December, the two and twentieth yeere of our Reigne. Anno 1579."
Reproduction of original in: Society of Antiquaries.
